Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.fasttrack.messenger

Interface MobileMessageManager

  • public interface MobileMessageManager
    This manager provides way to create outgoing messages for the server and send/fetch messages to/from the server.
    Since:
    5.3.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void acknowledgeMessage​(IncomingMessage incomingMessage, Map<String,​String> customHeaders, AcknowledgeCallback acknowledgeCallback)
      Sends a message acknowledgment to the server: the asynchronous variant.
      OutgoingMessage createGenericOutgoingMessage​(String contentType, byte[] content)
      Creates a generic message that can be sent to the OOB server.
      void fetchMessage​(int timeOut, Map<String,​String> customHeaders, FetchMessageCallback fetchMessageCallback)
      Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

      Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.
      void sendMessage​(OutgoingMessage outgoingMessage, Map<String,​String> customHeaders, SendMessageCallback sendMessageCallback)
      Sends a message to the server: the asynchronous variant.

    • Method Detail

      • createGenericOutgoingMessage

        OutgoingMessage createGenericOutgoingMessage​(@NonNull
                                             String contentType,
                                             @NonNull
                                             byte[] content)
        Creates a generic message that can be sent to the OOB server.
        Parameters:
        contentType - Message content-type.
        content - Message content.
        Returns:
        The generic message ready to be sent.

      • fetchMessage

        void fetchMessage​(int timeOut,
                  @Nullable
                  Map<String,​String> customHeaders,
                  @NonNull
                  FetchMessageCallback fetchMessageCallback)
        Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

        This method fetches the first message from server queue.

        This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        timeOut - Maximum time in second to wait for an incoming message.
        customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
        fetchMessageCallback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

      • fetchMessage

        void fetchMessage​(@NonNull
                  String messageId,
                  @Nullable
                  Map<String,​String> customHeaders,
                  @NonNull
                  FetchMessageCallback fetchMessageCallback)
        Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

        This method fetches the first message from server queue.

        This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        messageId - Identifier of the message to fetch.
        customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
        fetchMessageCallback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

      • acknowledgeMessage

        void acknowledgeMessage​(@NonNull
                        IncomingMessage incomingMessage,
                        @Nullable
                        Map<String,​String> customHeaders,
                        @NonNull
                        AcknowledgeCallback acknowledgeCallback)
        Sends a message acknowledgment to the server: the asynchronous variant.

        This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        incomingMessage - The incoming message to acknowledge.
        customHeaders - The request parameter containing the custom header.
        acknowledgeCallback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage​(@NonNull
                 OutgoingMessage outgoingMessage,
                 @Nullable
                 Map<String,​String> customHeaders,
                 @NonNull
                 SendMessageCallback sendMessageCallback)
        Sends a message to the server: the asynchronous variant.

        This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        outgoingMessage - The message to send.
        customHeaders - The request parameter containing the custom header.
        sendMessageCallback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.
